intro: Peucedanum villosum, commonly known as hairy cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-shaped clusters called umbels. The seeds are small, dry, and often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
